page.title: 06Housing N.E. of Baldock
page.content:
Housing outside Baldock consists of two basic types: (a) farms and farmworkers' houses. (b) commuter 20th century housing.
The farms vary. Bygrave has the Manor House, complete with moat, whereas along the Bygrave road, just outside Baldock there is a line of isolated houses which were originally smallholdings.
The hamlet of Bygrave also has a row of similar houses which were the workers' houses for the Manor estate.
The rest of Bygrave consists of commuter housing, with a strange section of commuter housing separated by about 1 km. from the hamlet proper.
